goal.ch:
This course aims to introduce advanced topics in physical chemistry that are of active
and central interest at the frontiers of research in physical sciences and engineering, as
well as their applications in materials and biology.
goal.en:
This course aims to introduce advanced topics in physical chemistry that are of active
and central interest at the frontiers of research in physical sciences and engineering, as
well as their applications in materials and biology.

outline.ch:
Quantum Entanglement, Bell’s Inequality and Quantum Computation
Density Functional Theory
Spin-Statistics, Fermi Liquids, and Bose-Einstein Condensates
Onsager Reciprocal Relations, Fluctuation Dissipation Theorem
Non-equilibrium fluctuation relations (Jarzynski, Crooks, single-molecule experiments)
Active Matter
Critical Phenomena and RG / Coarse-Graining & Effective Hamiltonians
Midterm
Rate Theory (Transition State Theory and Reactive Flux Theory)
Rare Event Methods (Path Sampling and Path Ensembles)
Classical Nucleation Theory
Polymer Statistics, Elasticity and Thermodynamics
Colloids and Entropic Phase Transitions
Granular Statistical Mechanics
Surfactants and Self-Assembly
Final Exam / Papers or Presentations
